name: Hilton Suites Chicago/Magnificent Mile

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 weeks and had a great time. Rooms are spacious, air-con kept rooms nice n'cool and beds were excellent. Great location and we found all the staff very helpful. Only minor gripe was housekeeping waking us up for something we didn't request. Note only rooms with single king are on lake side, we have 2 doubles which meant city side. We didn't have breakfast there and instead went to Tempo (UK tourist note food good but doesn't take cards so dollars go quickly), Corner bakery (Cedar and State) excellent food/value or LAppetitto (Hancock building). Given length of stay we found hotel to be excellent and would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: This hotel has nicely renovated suites but that's where the good news ends. We are Hilton Honor members but that means nothing to the management here. If you think you can check in at the stated check-in time at 3:00, don't get your hopes up. We couldn't check in until 4:30, but had to check out on- time the next day. I asked if they would compensate us for that somehow (maybe a free drink or breakfast), I was answered with an indifferent "No, we don't do that!"
reviews.title: Not The Best If You Expect Service

likes.liked: — Location near shops and suite accomodations

reviews.text: I requested extra towels but never got them. There wasn't any extra toilet paper in the room. We asked the concierge where was a good place to eat and she snapped, "Everything is booked until 10:00." She eventually got us a reservation but it was grudging. Odd job for someone with this temperament. We travel frequently and this is the first time I have been motivated to write this kind of review. Luckily, most of our travel experiences have been positive.
reviews.title: All show and no substance

reviews.text: The room is decent and reasonably comfortable. That is about all the complementary statements I can make. Expect no service, because you will get what you expect. When they say check in is at 3 pm, don't expect it a minute early. Don't store your bags with the bellman because you never know when you will see them again.
reviews.title: Great location, horrible service
Beware The Alcove
reviews.text: Don't ask for turn down service because that won't happen and don't ask for any special compensation because that won't happen.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From top to bottom, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff was attentive, efficient and friendly. Our room was absolutely lovely ... better than expected. We only had a short stay, and would have loved to have extended it, but unfortunately we did not pack accordingly.
reviews.title: Simply Delightful. Enough Said.

likes.liked: — The room was absolutely beautiful over looking the lake, and the bedding was quite comfortable.
likes.disliked: — The only negative is the price to have your car valet parked. We paid $49 before tip.

reviews.text: The room had a comfortable sitting area with a desk facing Oak Street Beach, a flat screen TV, and a convenient wet bar, microwave and mini refrigerator (all nicely concealed in beautiful cabinets.)
reviews.title: A New Favorite Place to Stay

likes.liked: — Great location, comfortable rooms, nice staff
likes.disliked: — No Free Wi-Fi (had to pay daily fee for internet access)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was quite spacious and tastefully decorated. It was accessible from both the sitting area and the master bedroom. Between the master bedroom and bathroom was a nice vanity area.
reviews.title: Good but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The master bedroom was also tastefully decorated with a very comfortable bed and a view of the lake. The bedding was top notch and what you would expect of nicer hotels. The hotel was very quiet, so you could really get a good nights sleep.
reviews.title: Very nice
A Wicked time in Chicago
reviews.text: We took advantage of the complimentary breakfest and was pleasantly surprised at the wide offerings, the helpful staff, and the views of city life bustling outside the window. They also had an outdoor cafe.

reviews.title: Great location, beautiful views - highly recommend!
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night at the end of a week-long business trip to Central Illinois. The room rate was cheaper than near the airport, so we thought we'd have some fun our last night. And the Hilton Suites didn't disappoint!

The staff was wonderful - starting with the valet attendants. (Yes, parking is $50, but it's that much everywhere in Chicago or most major cities.) The front desk staff was most helpful and freindly. The suite was on the 26th floor and had a nice view of Lake Michigan. There was an LCD TV in the living room area and an older TV in the bedroom. The rooms have been recently updated, as everything was nice and new.
reviews.title: Absolutely loved it

reviews.text: The pool and exercise room are on the top floor (30th) with a gorgeous view.
reviews.title: Great surprise

likes.liked: — Nice new two room suites with nice ammenities.
likes.disliked: — It was -13 when I stayed there but that's not the hotel's fault.

reviews.text: The restaurant was great for breakfast. The continental breakfast for Diamond members was rather sparse, but we could apply the voucher towards a full breakfast, which was delicious.
reviews.title: Good location and service

reviews.text: The location is great. We parked the car and didn't need it again. It's a one block walk to Michigan Avenue with lots of shops and restaurants right there.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel! Amazing Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, you cant beat the location. It's in the perfect spot on the Magnificent Mile and very close the lake. John Hancock tower is across the street and worth a visit. The hotel is on a quiet street away from the hustle and bustle which made it feel more like a local boutique hotel rather than a busy and noisy mega-hotel. The front desk staff was overly helpful and when I told the clerk I was craving clam chowder he proceeded to call all the local restaurants until he found one serving clam chowder! I was impressed.
reviews.title: Great Hotel. Great Location. Great staff.

likes.liked: — Location and the overall warm and inviting feel of the hotel
likes.disliked: — The front door staff was not very friendly but the rest of the staff made up for it.

reviews.text: The rooms are top notch and super clean. Maid service was superb and the common areas were all very clean and nicely appointed. I loved the top floor pool with the breathtaking view of the lake.
reviews.title: Good place to stay

likes.disliked: — cold draft everywhere; fitness rooms needs more weight equipment.

reviews.title: I always love to come back!
reviews.text: One person complained about the trash can being in the wrong place and said they wouldn't recommend the hotel...well I think that says it all when all you can find wrong with this hotel is a mis located trash can. It's a great place to stay....period.
Nice hotel. Used to be doubletree suites. Just south of Drake hotel.
reviews.title: Was better as a Doubletree

reviews.text: Remodeled property... much better place than as a doubletree.
reviews.title: Excellent Option in the Magnificent Mile area

description: Hilton Suites Chicago/Magnificent Mile hotel in downtown Chicago is an upscale all-suite property in a prime downtown Chicago location. Our modern, all suite-hotel provides comfortable, well-appointed two-room guest suites and executive accommodations.... more.
